results.title: The Three faces of Eve
results.creator_credit: Nunnally Johnson and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Joanne Woodward, in a performance which earned her the Oscar for Best Actress, plays Eve White, a mousy withdrawn housewife with multiple personalities. After startling her husband by behaving completely out of character, and having blackouts, Eve visits a psychiatrist, played by Lee J. Cobb. From these sessions, emerges the personality of Eve Black, a sexy, uninhibited woman who expresses those parts of Eve White’s personality which she has suppressed. Eventually, her third self emerges as Jane; an intelligent, sensible woman, who helps resolve and integrate the different facets of Eve’s personality into a whole and healthy human being. Based on a true story, this acclaimed drama explores the dimensions of the human mind.

results.title: The Thread makers
results.creator_credit: John Chittock, James Archibald and James Archibald and Associates
results.brief_description: Illustrates the nature of J. & B. Coats’ activities as makers and marketeers of thread of all types for every variety of use. Filmed in India, Austria, Spain, England and Scotland with a strong emphasis on the human interest. The development of synthetic thread, requiring new techniques and processes, is shown to be a likely prospect for the future

results.title: The Thomas Crown affair (Original)
results.creator_credit: Norman Jewison, Solar, Simkoel, Mirisch Corporation and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Picture the scenario of 5 men who have never met before entering and robbing a bank. Who is the mastermind behind this daring plan? Did he do it for the 2 million dollars or just for the thrill of the heist and the adrenaline rush of not getting caught. Thomas Crown (Steve McQueen) is a Boston tycoon with money to burn and so bored with everyday life that he plans a bank robbery. Does he get away with it or will he get caught by insurance investigator Vickey Anderson (Faye Dunaway)? A glossy cat and mouse caper directed by Norman Jewison whose use of the split screen image leaps from the boardroom to the boudoir, the polo field to a glider cockpit. The Oscar winning song “Windmills of your mind” sets the perfect tone for the swirls of romance and intrigue. The famed chess game seduction scene is a must see. Co-starring Paul Burke and Jack Weston.

results.title: The Thomas Crown affair
results.creator_credit: John McTiernan, Beau St Clair, Pierce Brosnan, Irish Dreamtime and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: This remake of the Steve McQueen movie of the same name stars Pierce Brosnan as thrill-seeking billionaire Thomas Crown. Bored with his life, he decides to stage a daring robbery and steal a priceless painting in broad daylight from one of the most secure museums in the world. Rene Russo stars as his nemesis - insurance investigator Catherine Manning, a woman who is every bit as intelligent, cunning and hungry for adventure as he is - and she will need to be is she is to outwit this master thief. Certain clues point to Crown, so Danning introduces herself into Crown’s social circle. Police detective Michael McCann (Denis Leary) warns Danning that Crown can easily draw people in with his effortless charm, and getting to close him will not be good for her investigation. She is amused by McCann’s suggestion — until she finds herself falling for Crown.

results.title: The Thirteenth floor
results.creator_credit: Josef Rusnak, Marco Weber, Roland Emmerich, Ute Emmerich and Centropolis Entertainment
results.brief_description: Hannon Fuller is a scientist intrigued by time-travel who designs a virtual reality program that allows the player to assume an identity in another era and experience first hand the milieu of the times. Unbeknownst to his co-worker Douglas Hall, Fuller has been using the software, downloading himself into Los Angeles 1937 - the setting of his childhood. When Fuller is brutally knifed to death one night, Hall is suspected of murder. Hall decides to travel back to 1937 to recover a message that Fuller has left for him in the system and hopefully identify the real killer. As the principal characters travel through time, they struggle to maintain their 1930s identities and face the danger of ruining their creation by exposing the game. “The Thirteenth floor” is a science fiction thriller that mimics the technical babble and mind-bending logic of “The Matrix” and “eXistenZ”, without ever really managing to achieve the accomplishments of those finer examples of the genre. The film, stylish in its recreation of the 1930s era and the computer saturated sleekness of the 90s, melds noirish aesthetics, romance, murder mystery and sci-fi adventuring.

results.title: The Thirteenth floor
results.brief_description: This film takes a humorous look at all the safety errors committed in a short time in a typical office. It is effective in pointing out the hazards which exist in offices and the accidents which workers can cause - or control.

results.title: Sense and sensibility (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Ang Lee, Lindsay Doran, Columbia Pictures and Mirage Enterprises
results.brief_description: Ang Lee directs this well scripted, acted and beautifully photographed version of Jane Austen’s first novel. Emma Thompson, (who wrote the screenplay), and Kate Winslet are Elinor and Marianne. Elinor follows her head and Marianne is guided by her heart. Both sisters eventually find love but only after the usual complications. A star-studded cast includes Hugh Grant and Alan Rickman

results.title: Sense and sensibility
results.creator_credit: Rodney Bennett, Barry Letts and BBC
results.brief_description: The story centres around two devoted sisters, Elinor, whose dignity and restraint represents “sense” and Marianne, excitable and impetuous, who represents “sensibility”. Forced by tragic circumstances to set about the delicate task of finding suitable husbands the two sisters suffer a series of disappointments and wonder if they will ever find true love and happiness. A dramatic adaptation of the novel by Jane Austen.

results.title: Video maker
results.creator_credit: Shane Yeend, Scott Young, Nine Network (Australia) and Alliance Productions
results.brief_description: Video maker is designed to help transform the confused home video operator into a budding video director. This tape looks at topics such as focus, handheld and zoom, camera editing, depth of field and exposure as well as looking at terminology, different filming techniques and equipment.

results.title: Senso daughters
results.creator_credit: Noriko Sekiguchi, Institute of Papua New Guinea Studies, Siglo Co and Tenchijin Productions
results.brief_description: Senso means “War”. “Senso daughters” is an account of the experience of Papua New Guinean and Japanese women in the South Pacific during World War II. A unique film in that it critically looks at the effect of the war not only on the indigenous culture but also on the Japanese people. Anti-war sentiment has never been tolerated within Japanese culture. For director, Noriko Sekiguchi, the film is very much a personal statement with a global message. Not only does the film critically question the war-time decisions of the late Emperor Hirohito, but it also makes public for the first time some startling information. The Japanese army took “comfort women” when they were occupying a new territory. The army prostitutes were conscripted from Korean and poor Japanese women and shipped to military bases in Rabaul.
